alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Greenbrier, northern Summers and northwestern Monroe Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Duo to near Jumping Branch. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg... Hinton... Ronceverte... Rainelle... Alderson... Rupert... and Quinwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier
